conversation.message: I am highly interested in the opportunities at Company_C, which is my top choice among all available companies. I believe my profile is a strong match for your requirements. I formally submit my application.
conversation.thought: As Seeker_C, my top preference is Company_C. Since this is Round 1 and quotas are limited (Capacity 1), applying directly to my top choice is the best strategy to maximize utility, assuming other seekers might target their own unique top preferences. Company_C ranks me 3rd (behind Seeker_A and Seeker_B). If Seeker_A targets Company_B and Seeker_B targets Company_A (their respective top choices), I will be the only applicant for Company_C and secure the match immediately. I must use [APPLY] to be considered for acceptance this round.

conversation.message: Thank you for your enthusiastic application, Seeker_C. We are very impressed by your profile and appreciate you ranking Company_C as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you the position immediately.
conversation.thought: I am Company_C. My goal is to match with the highest possible priority candidate (Quota: 1). My priority list is Seeker_A (P1), Seeker_B (P2), Seeker_C (P3). Seeker_C has submitted an [APPLY] request and indicated that Company_C is their top choice. Given that this is Round 1, it is highly likely that Seeker_A and Seeker_B have applied to their absolute top choices (Company_B and Company_A, respectively). Since all companies prioritize A and B highly, A and B are likely to secure matches elsewhere immediately. If A and B match out, Seeker_C (P3) represents the best available candidate for Company_C. Accepting Seeker_C now secures a strong match (P3) and fulfills the quota, preventing the risk of remaining unmatched or having to settle for a lower priority later.
